SEARCH

Class HospitalApp

java.lang.Object
HospitalApp
public class HospitalApp extends Object
The HospitalApp class serves as the entry point for the hospital management application. It manages user authentication and presents a menu for users to interact with the system. The application supports multiple user roles, including patients, doctors, pharmacists, and administrators. This class utilizes a Scanner for user input and a Login object for handling user login processes. It also uses StartUp.displayWelcomeMessage() to display a welcome message with a blinking effect at the start. Upon starting, the application displays a welcome message and enters a loop where it continuously prompts the user to log in and select options from the menu until the application is terminated.
See Also:

  • StartUp

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException, InterruptedException, IOException
      The main method is the entry point of the HospitalApp application. It initializes the application by displaying a welcome message and then enters a loop that allows users to log in and interact with the system based on their role.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used in this application)
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the specified file is not found during the login process
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs
      See Also:
      • StartUp.displayWelcomeMessage()
